unnormalised: Alright, let's talk about those pieces of paper we collect throughout our educational journeys – the certificates, degrees, and accolades. You know, the ones your parents proudly display? From scoring well in the Class 10th board exams to finally grabbing that PhD, each one represents a milestone, a late-night study session fueled by chai and Maggi, and the sheer will to learn. Let’s dive in!
normalised: Alright, let's talk about those pieces of paper we collect throughout our educational journeys - the certificates, degrees, and accolades. You know, the ones your parents proudly display? Let's dive in!

unnormalised: First off, there’s the humble Class 10th certificate. For many, it’s the first "official" achievement. Maybe you aced the CBSE exams with a 90%, or maybe you barely scraped through. Either way, it's a reminder of those carefree school days. It's also usually the first time you encounter abbreviations like "S.S.C" on a formal document.
normalised: First off, there's the humble Class tenth certificate. For many, it's the first "official" achievement. Maybe you aced the C-B-S-E exams with a ninety percent, or maybe you barely scraped through. Either way, it's a reminder of those carefree school days. It's also usually the first time you encounter abbreviations like "S-S-C" on a formal document.

unnormalised: Then comes the Class 12th mark sheet. More pressure, more expectations, right? This one often dictates which college you can get into. Did you manage to secure that coveted seat at IIT with your JEE score? Or perhaps you opted for a B.Com at Delhi University? A lot hinges on this one, and the percentage you score often becomes a topic of conversation at family gatherings. You'll start seeing more specific subject codes here as well, like PHY for Physics or MATH for Maths.

Did you manage to secure that coveted seat at I-I-T with your J-E-E score? Or perhaps you opted for a B dot Com at Delhi University? A lot hinges on this one, and the percentage you score often becomes a topic of conversation at family gatherings. You'll start seeing more specific subject codes here as well, like P-H-Y for Physics or M-A-T-H for Maths.

unnormalised: Undergraduate degrees – B.A., B.Sc., B.Tech – these are where things start getting specialised. Three or four years dedicated to a particular field. The B.Tech grads from IIT Bombay might land amazing jobs straight out of college, while others may pursue further studies. Remember that feeling when you finally submitted your final year project? The relief was immense!

unnormalised: And what about the postgraduate qualifications? M.A., M.Sc., MBA… These signify a deeper dive into your chosen subject. Securing an MBA from IIM Ahmedabad could open doors to a completely different career trajectory. And let's not forget the ever-growing popularity of specialized diplomas and certifications, like a "Dip. in Data Science" which promises a lucrative career path.

unnormalised: The pinnacle of academic achievement is undoubtedly the PhD. Years of research, countless hours in the lab or library, and a thesis that hopefully makes a meaningful contribution to your field. Dr. Sharma, for example, spent 6 years researching renewable energy solutions for rural India. The title "Dr." carries a lot of weight in Indian society, symbolizing expertise and dedication.

unnormalised: Beyond the formal degrees, there are also the certificates of participation in extracurricular activities – sports, debates, cultural events. These might seem trivial, but they add another dimension to your profile, showcasing your well-rounded personality. Did you win the inter-college debate competition? Or perhaps you represented your school in a state-level cricket tournament? These accomplishments should not be forgotten.

unnormalised: Ultimately, these certificates and achievements are more than just pieces of paper. They represent your hard work, dedication, and the journey you've undertaken to acquire knowledge and skills. They’re the stepping stones to your future. So, the next time you see that pile of certificates gathering dust, take a moment to appreciate them for what they truly are – a testament to your potential. They tell your story. Don't forget to also look into online certifications as well these days. Many online certifications hold value. Consider ones from Coursera, or NPTEL (National Programme on Technology Enhanced Learning, an initiative by IITs).
